Description: Rim sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of lotus flower in added white outline and added red centre, above two added white bands; exterior: dot and billet band at rim above hook maeander frieze between lines; below, painted decoration consisting of goose (head and neck remaining) to left; large floral pattern, elaborate swastika and rosette as filling ornament.
Producer name: Attributed to: Group of the Aphrodite Bowl
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as part of the Group of the Aphrodite Bowl because it displays a great amount of variety in the filling ornaments, similar to those on the Aphrodite Bowl (Lemos 1991, 74-5). The sherd ought to belong to the later period of the Wild Goat Style since, although the metopal pattern decoration on the exterior surface is typical of the Wild Goat Style, the lotus decoration on the interior, which is absent during this period, is typical in the later reserved Animal Chalice, Grand and Chalice styles. Furthermore, geese are very rarely portrayed in the Mature Animal Style. The number 652 (?) is written in pencil on the interior.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 38, p. 74, p. 236, no. 150, pl. 14)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0403) (phase 2)
